body_html:
@roosdebildt yes, the <head> section 😄

The application layout file has a yield :head if content_for?(:head) call in line 12. You can read up on content_for to inject content from a sub-template into that layout file. That way it's possible to have it in <head>, but only on that specific page.
body_text:
@roosdebildt yes, the <head> section 😄
The application layout file has a yield :head if content_for?(:head) call in line 12. You can read up on content_for to inject content from a sub-template into that layout file. That way it's possible to have it in <head>, but only on that specific page.
body:
@roosdebildt yes, the `<head>` section :smile: 

The application layout file has a `yield :head if content_for?(:head)` call in line 12. You can read up on `content_for` to inject content from a sub-template into that layout file. That way it's possible to have it in `<head>`, but only on that specific page.
